entry.title: The Water and Sewerage Charges (Exemption) (Scotland) Regulations 2002
entry.summary: These regulations are made under sections 40 and 68(2) of the Water Industry (Scotland) Act 2002 (asp 3). Article 3 provides that persons (which includes individuals, companies, incorporated bodies and partnerships) shall be exempt from charges for water and sewerage services if the conditions in regulations 6 to 8 are fulfilled. The exemption applies from the financial year in which the statement and information provided for in regulation 8 are given to Scottish Water until 31 March 2006 (regulation 4). The exemption is lost if the statement or information is inaccurate or misleading.

entry.title: The Parkside National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) No. 2 Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the University College London Hospitals National Health Service Trust and Chelsea and Westminster Healthcare National Health Service Trust trust property held by the Parkside National Health Service Trust and makes related provision. A copy of the schedules specifying the trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The Health Act 1999 (Commencement No. 12) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 1st April 2002 section 60(3) of the Health Act 1999 (partially) and repeals in Schedule 5 to the Act (partially). The effect is that certain provisions in the Nurses, Midwives and Health Visitors Act 1997 and the Professions Supplementary to Medicine Act 1960 are repealed in consequence of the coming into force of the Nursing and Midwifery Order 2001 (S.I. 2002/253) and the Health Professions Order 2001 (S.I. 2002/254). Other provisions in the 1997 and 1960 Acts were repealed by virtue of S.I. 2001/1985.

title.div: The Local Government (Whole Authority Analyses and Improvement Plans) (Wales) Order 2002 / Gorchymyn Llywodraeth Leol (Dadansoddiadau Awdurdodau Cyfan a Chynlluniau Gwella) (Cymru) 2002

div.p: Part I of the Local Government Act 1999 imposes duties on local and other authorities to conduct best value reviews of their functions and to prepare a best value performance plan (in this Order called an “improvement plan”) for each financial year.

Mae Rhan I o Ddeddf Llywodraeth Leol 1999 yn gosod dyletswydd i awdurdodau lleol ac awdurdodau eraill gynnal adolygiadau gwerth gorau o'u swyddogaethau a llunio cynllun perfformiad gwerth gorau (yn y Gorchymyn hwn fe'u gelwir yn “gynlluniau gwella”) ar gyfer pob blwyddyn ariannol.

entry.title: The Sussex Weald and Downs National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the Worthing and Southlands Hospitals National Health Service Trust and West Sussex Health and Social Care National Health Service Trust, trust property held by the Sussex Weald and Downs National Health Service Trust and makes related provision. A copy of the schedules specifying the trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The Water Industry (Scotland) Act 2002 (Consequential and Savings Provisions) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order, made under sections 24(3), 68(2), (3) and 69, of the Water Industry Act 2002 (asp 3) sets out additional provisions relating to the transfer of functions, property and liabilities from the new water and sewerage authorities to Scottish Water. Article 3 makes consequential and savings provisions relating to the transfer of property and liabilities. Articles 4 and 5 make provision to save the current charges schemes and codes of practice made under the provisions of Local Government etc. (Scotland) Act 1994 until a replacement scheme and code can be made under the provisions of the Water Industry (Scotland) Act 2002. Article 6 makes consequential provisions relating to the billing and collection of water and sewerage charges by local authorities.. Article 7 makes consequential provisions arising from the provisions of a domestic water and sewerage charges reduction scheme. Article 8 makes consequential provisions to the Council Tax (Administration and Enforcement) (Scotland) Regulations 2002 to allow local authorities to recover charges due to Scottish Water.

entry.title: The Housing Support Grant (Scotland) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order fixes for the year 2002–2003 the aggregate amount of the housing support grants payable to some local authorities under section 191 of the Housing (Scotland) Act 1987 (article 2). The Order provides (article 3(1)) for the aggregate amount to be divided into general and hostel provisions. Article 3(2) and Schedule 1 prescribe the local authorities among whom the grants for the general portion will be apportioned. Schedule 2 provides the method of calculation. Article 3(3) and Schedule 3 prescribe the local authorities among whom the grants for the hostel portion will be apportioned and the method of calculation.

entry.title: The South West London Community National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) No. 2 Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the Nelson and West Merton Primary Care Trust and Teddington, Twickenham and Hamptons Primary Care Trust, trust property held by the South West London Community National Health Service Trust and makes related provision. A copy of the schedules specifying the trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The Disease Control (Interim Measures) (England) (Amendment) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order amends the Disease Control (Interim Measures) (England) Order 2002 (the “principal Order”) (S.I. 2002/242).

entry.title: The Public Finance and Accountability (Scotland) Act 2000 (Consequential Modifications) Order 2002
entry.summary: This version of the The Public Finance and Accountability (Scotland) Act 2000 (Consequential Modifications) Order 2002 is the published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer for Scotland. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Social Security (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Income Support (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987, the Housing Benefit (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987 and the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996.

entry.title: The Abortion (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations which extend to England amend the Abortion Regulations 1991 (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Rabies (Importation of Dogs, Cats and Other Mammals) (Amendment) (Wales) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order, which applies to Wales, further amends the Rabies (Importation of Dogs, Cats and Other Mammals) Order 1974 (S.I. 1974/2211).

entry.title: The Health Professions Order 2001 (Consequential Amendments) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order makes a number of amendments to secondary legislation consequential on the making of the Health Professions Order 2001 (S.I. 2002 No. 254) and the repeal of parts of the Professions Supplementary to Medicine Act 1960 as a result of which the Council for Professions Supplementary to Medicine has been replaced by the Health Professions Council.

entry.title: The Plant Health (Great Britain) Amendment (Scotland) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order amends the Plant Health (Great Britain) Order 1993 (“the principal Order”), in relation to Scotland, so as to implement certain elements of Commission Directives 2002/28/EC (O.J. No. L 77 20.3.02, p.23) and 2002/29/EC (O.J. No. L 77, 20.3.02, p.26) which are not implemented in other legislation. Commission Directive 2002/29/EC amends the protected zones established under Council Directive 2000/29/EC (OJ No. L169, 10.7.00, p.1) (“the principal Plant Health Directive”) and scheduled in the Annex to Commission Directive 2001/32/EC (O.J. No. L 127, 9.5.01, p.38). Directive 2002/28/EC provides for consequential amendments to certain Annexes of the principal Plant Health Directive.

entry.title: The Care Standards Act 2000 (Establishments and Agencies) (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations, which apply to England only, amend the following Regulations made under the Care Standards Act 2000 (“the Act”):

entry.title: The Care Standards Act 2000 (Commencement No. 14 (England) and Transitional, Savings and Amendment Provisions) Order 2002
entry.summary: This Order brings into force, in relation to England only, certain provisions of the Care Standards Act 2000 which amend other statutory provisions (article 3). They amend the Protection of Children Act 1999, to allow certain authorities to refer persons for inclusion in the list of individuals considered unsuitable to work with children. They also amend provisions in the Children Act 1989 concerning persons disqualified from carrying on or being employed in children’s homes and related appeals.

entry.title: The Education (School Teachers' Pay and Conditions) Order 2002

category.term: Special educational needs and additional support

entry.summary: This Order amends the School Teachers' Pay and Conditions Document 2001 (the Document) by uprating the amounts of salary and certain allowances. The following are increased—

entry.title: The Occupational and Personal Pension Schemes (Bankruptcy) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2002
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for the treatment of rights under certain pension arrangements in the event of a person’s bankruptcy.

entry.title: The Regulatory Reform (Voluntary Aided Schools Liabilities and Funding) (England) Order 2002

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Regulatory Reform (Voluntary Aided Schools Liabilities and Funding) (England) Order 2002

entry.summary: This Order is made under section 1 of the Regulatory Reform Act 2001. It amends sections 22 and 49, paragraphs 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 of Schedule 3, paragraph 14 of Schedule 6 and Schedule 22 of the School Standards and Framework Act 1998, so as to reform the liabilities and funding arrangements for premises-related work of voluntary aided schools, which impose burdens on governing bodies and local education authorities carrying out certain activities, with a view to reducing the overall burdens on them.
